alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Chilton; Coosa; Shelby (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 5:02PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Chilton, southeastern Shelby, southeastern Bibb and northwestern Coosa Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 501 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lay Lake to near Thorsby to 8 miles southwest of Lawley. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clanton, Jemison, Thorsby, Maplesville, Gap Of The Mountain, Parnell, Strickland Crossroads, Marble Valley, Lawley, Lay Lake Dam, Talladega National Forest, Chilton County Motor Sports Park, Lay Lake, Pooles Crossroads, Mitchell Lake, Randolph, Lomax, Shelby Shores, Stanton and Waxahatchee Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
